definition: to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
variant of 殮|殓[lian4]
to hold back/to restrain/to control (oneself)/to collect/Taiwan pr. [lian4]
money/wealth/riches/property/valuables

sentences.english: Dear Wang Hai, Indian politician are very busy making money for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 亲爱的王海，印度政客正忙于为自己敛财。

sentences.english: At the same time, there is an enormous potential windfall in the taxation of marijuana.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，对大麻征税蕴含着一个巨大的敛财的潜力。

sentences.english: But what is saddening is that they are doing so by exploiting the poor.
sentences.chinese: 但让人痛心的是，他们是靠剥削穷人来敛财的。

sentences.english: Nor is it just a matter of pumping in ever more taxpayers' cash.
sentences.chinese: 这种投资也不只是从纳税者手中敛财的问题。

definition: to collect money/to raise funds (for charity)
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/exploitation
lit. to dredge for money/to make money by reprehensible means/to fish for a quick buck
to fabricate excuses (idiom)/to concoct various items (e.g. to pad an expense account)
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to be corrupt/corruption/to embezzle
to profiteer/profiteering
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
to buy a title/to use wealth to acquire office
to cheat/to deceive
to bribe/a bribe
blinded by greed (idiom)
to swindle/to cheat
buying and selling of official positions
